hypothesis.title: Music Cognition vs Circle Of Fifths Controlled Comparison
hypothesis.question: How does harmonic profile strategy influence perceived consonance, roughness, and continuity in a controlled harmonic micro-study?
hypothesis.hypothesis: If we render one identical arrangement with harmonic profile strategy while holding all other musical factors fixed, then listener ratings will show a consistent ordering in perceived consonance, roughness, and continuity between versions, because this variable changes tension-release contour and perceptual expectation without introducing mix or instrumentation confounds.
hypothesis.rationaleMd:
Selected sources span acoustic mechanisms (ratio, periodicity, temperament) and structural/cognitive mechanisms (harmonic topology, pitch-space organization, historical usage), allowing non-tuning and tuning variables to be compared under one protocol [S1, S2, S3].

The selected evidence supports manipulating harmonic profile strategy while keeping tuning fixed as a control, so broader musical and perceptual hypotheses can be tested without collapsing to temperament-only framing [S1, S2, S3, S4, S5, S6].

Falsification criterion: if blinded ratings show no stable ordering across versions in perceived consonance, roughness, and continuity, or if annotations fail to cluster by condition, the hypothesis is not supported.

recipe.title: Music Cognition Comparison Micro-Study
recipe.bodyMd:
## Goal
Evaluate harmonic profile strategy under controlled musical conditions using a blinded comparison design.

## Shared Arrangement
- Tempo: 82 BPM
- Meter: 4/4
- Length: 24-32 bars
- Keep MIDI notes, sound sources, automation, and mix balance identical across versions.

## Variable Under Test
- Change only: harmonic profile strategy
- Keep all non-target variables fixed.

## Evaluation
- Blind-label exports and rate: perceived consonance, roughness, and continuity.
- Annotate bar/chord locations where roughness is strongest.

Evidence basis: [S1, S2, S3, S4, S5, S6].

parameters.value: Sustained triadic texture with fixed voicing
Octatonic scale (half-step/whole-step diminished): 8 tones, 4-fold rotational symmetry, maximally even
Hexatonic scale: 6 tones, 3-fold rotational symmetry, not maximally even
Interval size range for adjacent scale degrees: 1–3 semitones (cross-cultural norm)

dawChecklist: Create one master MIDI arrangement template.
Freeze instrument and FX chain before rendering comparison arms.
Render Version A with harmonic profile: Octatonic scale (half-step/whole-step diminished): 8 tones, 4-fold rotational symmetry, maximally even.
Render Version B with harmonic profile: Hexatonic scale: 6 tones, 3-fold rotational symmetry, not maximally even.
Render Version C with harmonic profile: Interval size range for adjacent scale degrees: 1–3 semitones (cross-cultural norm).
Keep tuning fixed at 12-tone equal temperament across all versions.
Match loudness across exports to remove gain bias.
Rename exports to blind labels (e.g., X/Y/Z).
Rate each version for perceived consonance, roughness, and continuity.
Capture bar-level notes for perceptual spikes.
Summarize whether observed ordering supports or contradicts hypothesis.

protocol.listeningContext: Quiet room; repeat on headphones and monitors at fixed playback level.
protocol.listeningMethod: Blinded multi-version comparison with consistent rating rubric.
